_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Impossibilities and Possibilities [an1.2: It is impossible for two wheel-turning monarchs to arise in the same solar system at the same time.
It is possible for just one wheel-turning monarch to arise in one solar system.
It is impossible for a woman to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
It is possible for a man to be a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
It is impossible for a woman to be a wheel-turning monarch.
It is possible for a man to be a wheel-turning monarch.
It is impossible for a woman to perform the role of Sakka, M훮ra, or Brahm훮.
It is possible for a man to perform the role of Sakka, M훮ra, or Brahm훮.
It is impossible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad bodily conduct.
It is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad bodily conduct.
It is impossible for a likable, desirable, agreeable result to come from bad verbal or bad mental conduct.
It is possible for an unlikable, undesirable, disagreeable result to come from bad verbal or bad mental conduct.
